info.title: Telzio API
info.description: Telzio's next generation API to power dashboard, mobile and desktop apps.

post.description: Request a JWT claims token and basic provisioning data.

username.description: The user's username. Not case sensitive.

mfa_code.description:
The MFA code for the user's login session. Required if multi-factor authentication is enabled on the user's account.
If MFA is enabled and this property is not included in the request, the API will reject the login and ask for an MFA code.

get.description: Refreshes the user's initial provisioning data, including basic account information and data about available numbers.
Generates a one time use set of parameters needed to create a SIP Connection and WebRTC Session

post.description: Updates the user's push-token.

device_id.description: A unique ID representing the device. This will remain the same when when logging out of the app and signing back in with a different username.

token.description: The push notification token created by the device.

delete.description: Removes a user's push token for the specified device id from the server. For example if the user logs out of the app, or if the app has been deleted from the device.

device_id.description: The unique ID to identify the specific device.

post.description:
Request a password reset link to be sent to the user's email. Will always return 200 OK, no matter if a matching username was found or not.
If the username was found, this method will send an email with a link that includes a token to reset the user's password. This token can be used in the update-password method.

username.description: The username of the user to request a password reset link for.

post.description: Updates the user's password.

user_id.description: The unique ID for the user updating the password.

token.description: The temporary token to authenticate the user for a password update request.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all call flows if the user is an administrator or has permissions to manage call flows.

post.description: Updates the name or extension of a Call Flow.

extension.description: The new extension of the Call Flow

name.description: The new name of the Call Flow

get.description: Returns the details for a call.
Retrieves a list of the users most recent calls.

parameters.name: filter_by
parameters.description: Filter the list of recent calls

get.description: Lists comments on an item. By default sorted by `created` in descending order. Use `starting_after` and `ending_before` to do paging or retrieve latest messages since last request.

post.description: Create a new comment on an item.

text.example: I May Be An Idiot, But There's One Thing I'm Not Sir, And That Is An Idiot.

post.description: Updates an existing comment on an item. This can only be done by the user who created the comment in the first place.

text.example: I May Be An Idiot, But There's One Thing I'm Not Sir, And That Is An Idiot.

delete.description: Deletes a comment from a voicemail. This can only be done by by an administrator or the user who created the comment.

post.description: Queries if a conversation with one or more participants already exist, and returns the exiting conversation_id if it does. If a conversation exists, that the requester doesn't have access to, the conversation_id is returned, and can be used to request access to the conversation.

participants.description: List of remote participants in the conversation. Currently exactly one must be provided.

number_id.description: Number ID this message should be sent from. The user must have access to this number.

post.description: Allows the user to request that a conversation which is currently assigned to someone else, to be either closed or reassigned to the user.

message.description: A message sent to the current owners of the conversation, optionally specifying why access is needed.

get.description: Retrieves a list of conversations. `Items` will only include the most recent entry. `Assignments` will only include the current assignment. `Comments` are not included in this response.
This request includes the 20 most recent items (for example SMS messages) in the conversation, as well as the basic meta data, such as comments, assignments, tags, etc.

post.description: Updates certain details on an existing conversation, assignments and tags.

tags.description: Change the tags assigned to the conversation.

assigned_user.description: Reassign the conversation to another user. Only `assigned_user` or `assigned_user_group` can be sat, but not both at the same time.

assigned_user_group.description: Reassign the conversation to a group of users. Only `assigned_user` or `assigned_user_group` can be sat, but not both at the same time.

delete.description: Deletes a conversation and all included items, comments, etc. _This can not be undone._

delete.summary: Delete a message in a ImMessage conversation
delete.description: Deletes a conversation and all included items, comments, etc. _This can not be undone._

get.description: By default this request will retrieve 20 items ordered by `id` in descending order. Use `starting_after` for updating an already populated dataset, and `ending_before` for paging.

post.description: Creates a new conversation intended for an SMS message. This is a temporary endpoint that will change in the future as all item types become part of conversations.

number_id.description:
Number ID to send message from. Will be users default number if not specified.
Only used if creating a new conversation.

text.description: The text to send. This can be null if media is added.
text.example: Oh, and tell Cookie Monster not to phone me until he finishes rehab.

media_attachments.description: List of ID's of the previously uploaded media files to attached with the message.

post.description: Sends a new SMS as part of an existing conversation

text.description: The text to send. This can be null if media is added.
text.example: Oh, and tell Cookie Monster not to phone me until he finishes rehab.

media_attachments.description: List of ID's of the previously uploaded media files to attached with the message.

post.description: Endpoint to upload binary data and temporarily hold it before sending it in an SMS.

get.description: Retrieves a media file included in an SMS
Lists the data retention settings for all data types on the account.

post.description: Change the number of days that various records in Telzio are retained.

days.description: The number of days Telzio should retain data of this type. Setting this value to NULL will let Telzio store the data indefinitely.

get.description: Returns the user's available Fax. By default ordered by `created` descending. Use `starting_after` and `ending_before` to do paging or retrieve latest messages since last request.
Returns the details of an existing Fax.

post.description: Update status, assignments and tags on an existing fax.

tags.description: Change the tags assigned to the voicemail.

assigned_user.description: Reassign the voicemail to another user. Only `assigned_user` or `assigned_user_group` can be sat, but not both at the same time.

assigned_user_group.description: Reassign the voicemail to a group of users. Only `assigned_user` or `assigned_user_group` can be sat, but not both at the same time.

delete.description: Permanently delete a Fax. This can not be undone. Also deleted any comments, tags or assignments attached to the Fax.

get.description: Retrieves the PDF containing the actual fax.
Get a list of all hold music songs on the account.

post.description: Add a new song to the library of hold music.

file.description: An mp3, wav or m4a file with a max file size of 15mb and max duration of 15 min.
An mp3, wav or m4a file with a max file size of 15mb and max duration of 15 min.

get.description: Retrieves the details for a specific hold music song.
Download the wav encoded hold music song.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the returned file.

get.description: Returns all effective and upcoming policies in their most recent version.
Returns policy description for the specified policy key and version

parameters.name: policy_key
parameters.description: Policy key to view

parameters.name: policy_version
parameters.description: Policy version to view

post.description: Provides consent for the specified policy. If a new claims token is returned this must be used for all subsequent requests to the API

parameters.name: policy_key
parameters.description: The policy key of the policy you want to consent to.

parameters.name: policy_version
parameters.description: The policy version of the policy you want to consent to.

post.description: Submit technical log entries from the client app.

entries.description:
A list of entries to submit to the log.
You can submit up to 100 entries per request by specifying them in a collection this way;
entries[0][created]
entries[0][message]
entries[0][severity]
entries[1][created]
entries[2][message]
entries[3][severity]
etc...

get.description: Lists all preference bundles for the user.
Retrieves a specific preference bundle

Retrieves a list of queues the current user has access to. If the user is an administrator or has permissions to manage queues, then this will return all queues. Otherwise, it will only return the queues the user is an agent of.
Retrieves a specific queue, including it's agents and current calls

post.description: Updates an agent in a queue.

enabled.description: Defines if the user is available to take calls or not.

grace_time.description: Defines a period if time to wait after each ended call, before accepting a new call. Value in seconds.

post.description: Updates an agent's availability across all queues it is member of

enabled.description: Defines if the user is available to take calls or not.

get.description: Lists all the recordings the user has access to.
Retrieves the details about a specific recording.

parameters.name: recording_id
parameters.description: The ID of the recording to retrieve.

post.description: Update tags or reassign a recording to another user or user group.

parameters.name: recording_id
parameters.description: The ID of the recording to update.

tags.description: Change the tags assigned to the recording

assigned_user.description: Reassign the recording to another user. Only `assigned_user` or `assigned_user_group` can be sat, but not both at the same time.

assigned_user_group.description: Reassign the recording to a group of users. Only `assigned_user` or `assigned_user_group` can be sat, but not both at the same time.

delete.description: Delete a recording and all it's comments and other meta data. _This cannot be undone._

parameters.name: recording_id
parameters.description: The ID of the recording to delete.

get.description: Download the MP3 file of a recording.

parameters.name: recording_id
parameters.description: The ID of the recording to download.

get.description: Retrieves a list of spam filter rules on the account.

post.description: Adds a new rule to the spam filter.

number_id.description: Specify an ID of a number on the account to let the rule apply only to that number.

get.description: Retrieves a specific spam filter rule.

delete.description: Delete a rule from the spam filter

post.description: Update an existing spam filter rule.

number_id.description: Specify an ID of a number on the account to let the rule apply only to that number.

get.description: Get a list of all tags currently associated with the account.

post.description: Create a tag to be used on the account.

name.description: A human readable name for the tag.

delete.description: Delete a tag from the account.

get.description: Lists the events (comments, tags, etc.) associated with an item on the user's account, such as a voicemail or recording.

parameters.name: timeline_id
parameters.description: The ID if the item to list timeline events for, for example a voicemail or call recording.

get.description: Retrieves a list of users on the account. By default ordered by `firstname_lastname`. Use `limit` and `starting_after` for paging.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: The field to sort the results by.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of results to return.

parameters.name: starting_page_id
parameters.description: Pass the value from next_page_id to start from a certain page in the list.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: Free text search term.

parameters.name: starting_after
parameters.description: Unused for this endpoint

parameters.name: ending_before
parameters.description: Unused for this method

get.description: Retrieves a single user, either by user_id, username, or extension.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of additional items to include in the response

get.description: Retrieves a list of numbers a user has access to.
Retrieves a list of user groups on the account.
Retrieves a single user group.

Retrieves a snapshot of the queried users' current status on the Telzio platform.
You can query up to 50 usernames in one request, by including the `u` query parameter multiple times in your request.
After the initial query, realtime updates are provided via websockets.

parameters.name: u
parameters.description: Username(s) to query state for. Can be set up to 50 times.

get.description: Returns a jpg of the user's avatar.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the user.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the returned avatar. `small` = 30x30px, `medium` = 90x90px, `large` = 250x250px.

post.description: Upload a new avatar for a user.

file.description: A picture to use as the user's avatar.
A picture to use as the user's avatar.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the user.

post.description:
Updates the personal voicemail greeting for a user.
Only the user self, or someone with user_admin permissions can edit a user's personal voicemail greeting.

get.description: Download the audio file of the user's current voicemail greeting.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the returned file.

get.description: Returns a list of voices that are available for text-to-speech generation.
Returns a list of available time zones.
Creates and returns an audio file to be used for text-to-speech previews.

parameters.name: voice_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the voice used to generate the preview.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text used when generating the preview.

get.description: Returns the user's available voicemails. By default sorted by _`_created_`_ and returned in descending order. Use _`starting_after`_ and _`ending_before`_ to do paging or retrieve latest messages since last request.

Returns the details of an existing voicemail. Only voicemails assigned to the user can be retrieved. Attempting to retrieve a voicemail the isn't assigned to the user, will result in a *403 Forbidden* response.

tags.description: Change the tags assigned to the voicemail.

assigned_user.description: Reassign the voicemail to another user. Only `assigned_user` or `assigned_user_group` can be sat, but not both at the same time.

assigned_user_group.description: Reassign the voicemail to a group of users. Only `assigned_user` or `assigned_user_group` can be sat, but not both at the same time.

delete.description: Permanently delete a voicemail. This can not be undone.

get.description: Fetches, decrypts and returns the voicemail in MP3 format.
Returns history of assignments for the voicemail.

type.description: The object type that access is being requested for.

account_id.description: The unique ID of the Telzio Account.

company_name.description: The company name of the Telzio customer.

created.description: When the Telzio account was created.

default_timezone.description: The default timezone for the account.

text.description: The text to update the CNAM value with before showing it to the receiver of the call.

data.description: A list of objects containing the basic details about each voicemail message.

has_more.description: Defines if there are more objects available via paging.

username.description: The user's username. Not case sensitive.

mfa_code.description:
The MFA code for the user's login session. Required if multi-factor authentication is enabled on the user's account.
If MFA is enabled and this property is not included in the request, the API will reject the login and ask for an MFA code.

release_sipis.description:
When set to true, any SIPIS registration for the user is released.
This is a temporary fix during migration from SIPIS-based app, to avoid Telzio 5.x.x from crashing when receiving push notifications intended for a SIPIS-based app.

do_not_disturb.description: If true, the user has enabled Do Not Disturb and will be receiving any calls.
If true, the user has enabled Do Not Disturb and will be receiving any calls.

BadRequestError.title: Bad Request

message.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error. This error can be shown to the end user.
message.example: The request had one or more invalid parameters.

parameters.description: A list of invalid parameters and corresponding error messages.

BadRequestError.description: Describes an error caused by an invalid API request.

BadRequestErrorType.description: For some errors that could be handled programmatically, a short string indicating the error code reported.

call_id.description: The unique ID of this call.

from.description: The user or phone number who made the call.

to.description: The user or phone number of the receiver.

created.description: The date and time the call was started.

duration.description: The duration of the call in seconds.

legs.description: Child call legs associated with the call.

events.description: List of technical events that happened during the call.

voicemail_id.description: The unique ID of a voicemail associated with this call.

recording_id.description: The unique ID of a call recording associated with this call.

fax_id.description: The unique ID of a fax associated with this call.

tags.description: A list of tags assigned to this call.

price.description: The price of the call, excluding fees.

fees.description: The total of taxes and fees for the call.

total_price.description: The total price for the call, including fees.

free_minutes.description: The amount of free minutes used by the call.

CallDestinationCallFlow.description: Transfer calls to a call flow.

CallDestinationPhoneNumber.description: Transfer calls to an external phone number.

CallDestinationUserGroup.description: Transfer calls to a group of users.

assignment.description: Who new voicemail messages are assigned to.

transcription_enabled.description: If set to true, Telzio will attempt to transcribe the voicemail messages.

date.description: The date and time the event occurred.

call_flow_id.description: The unique ID of the call flow.

name.description: The name of the call flow

numbers.description: The numbers on the customer's account, currently associated with this call flow.

call_id.description: The unique ID of this call.

from.description: The username or phone number of the caller.

from_name.description: The human-readable name of the caller.

to.description: The username or phone number of the receiver.

hangup_cause.description: The technical reason why the call ended.

duration.description: The duration of the call in seconds.

call_date.description: The date and time the call was started.

answer_date.description: The date and time the call was answered by the receiving party.

end_date.description: The date and time the call ended.

spam_score.description: The call's spam score in percent. This may not be present on all calls.

spam_action.description: The action taken as result of the call's Spam Score.

blacklisted.description: The call was blocked as a result of a rule on the account's blacklist.

Caller.description: A message or item that was created during a conversation.

device_locale.description: The current language selected for the phone.

app_install_id.description: A GUID generated by the app upon first run after installation.

device_locale.description: The current language selected for the phone.

device_os_version.description: The current OS version of the device.

app_version.description:
The version of the app making request.
Format: major.minor.build, and major MUST be 5, and the minor and build version must not start with a zero.

app_build_number.description: The build number of the app

app_install_id.description: A GUID generated by the app upon first run after installation.

device_hardware_id.description:
The unique ID of the hardware running the app.
For iOS this is the IDFV (https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uidevice/1620059-identifierforvendor).
For Android this is the ANDROID_ID (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/provider/Settings.Secure#ANDROID_ID)

device_locale.description: The current language selected for the phone.

device_name.description: The name of the device as set by the user.

device_brand.description: The manufacturer of the device. For example, Apple, Samsung, Motorola, etc.

device_model.description: The specific model of the device.

device_os_version.description: The current OS version of the device.

mobile_network_country_iso.description: The country ISO Alpha-2 value of the country where the device is currently connected to the mobile network.

mobile_network_name.description: The sim card issuer's network name

sim_country_iso.description: The sim card issuer's country iso

sim_country_code.description: The sim card's phone number's country code

comment_id.description: The unique ID of the comment.

text.description: The actual text content of the comment.
text.example: This customer would like some assistance with his account.

created.description: When the first item in the conversation was created, or in other words when the conversation was started.

last_item_created.description: When the most recent item was added to the conversation.

new_items.description: True if this conversation has new items.

participants.description: A list of participants in the conversation, or in other words all users and external phone numbers that have created an item in this conversation.

items.description: A message or item that was created during a conversation.
The list of `ConversationItem` in the particular conversation. Currently, there is only one type; `Sms`.

has_more_items.description: Indicates if the conversation has more items that can be retrieved using the List Conversation Items endpoint.

assignments.description: A chronological list of who the conversation has been assigned to over time.

tags.description: List of current tags on the conversation.

Conversation.description:
A conversation is a chronologically ordered thread of items that all share the same context, for example `call`, `sms`, `voicemail`, `recording`, etc.
Currently, a conversation can only contain `Sms` items, but this schema is designed for the next generation of Telzio's dashboard and apps, which will be focused around an omnichannel conversation concept.
A conversation is always assigned to either a specific `user` or a `user_group`.

ConversationInaccessibleError.title: Forbidden

message.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error. This error can be shown to the end user.
message.example: You do not have permissions to perform this request.

current_owner.description: The user or group this conversation is presently assigned to.

ConversationInaccessibleError.description: Describes an error caused by an invalid API request.

ConversationItem.description: A message or item that was created during a conversation.

items.description: A message or item that was created during a conversation.

data.description: This list only includes the most recent item in each conversation.

next_starting_after.description: The next value to provide as starting_after to page this response

ConversationStatus.description: The current status of the conversation.

days.description: How many days Telzio should retain the data type before deleting or anonymizing it. NULL means that data is retained indefinitely.

fax_id.description: The unique ID of the fax.

call_id.description: The ID of the call associated with the fax.

created.description: The date and time the fax was sent or received.

assigned_to.description: The user or group the fax currently is assigned to.

tags.description: A list of objects containing the tags that are currently assigned to the voicemail.

fax_id.description: The unique ID of the fax.

call_id.description: The ID of the call associated with the fax.

created.description: The date and time the fax was sent or received.

assigned_to.description: The user or group the fax currently is assigned to.

tags.description: A list of objects containing the tags that are currently assigned to the voicemail.

data.description: List of timeline events created (if any) by this update.

enabled_features.description: A list of features that are enabled/disabled for the user.

web_phone.description: Enable or disable the web phone.

ForbiddenError.title: Forbidden

message.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error. This error can be shown to the end user.
message.example: You do not have permissions to perform this request.

ForbiddenError.description: Describes an error caused by an invalid API request.

hold_music_id.description: The unique ID for the song.

created.description: When the message was sent or received.

is_deleted.description: Indicates if the message is deleted

title.description: Title of policy. Used when displaying the policy's body.

body.description: HTML Formatted body, containing the actual text.

effective_date.description: Date from when this policy/version is effective.

superceeding_key.description: The `policy_key` of a newer policy that replaces this one. Used in conjunction with superceeding_version to retrieve the superceeding policy.

superceeding_version.description: The `policy_version` of a newer policy that replaces this one. Used in conjunction with superceeding_key to retrieve the superceeding policy.

consent_required.description: Specifies if consent is required for continued use of Telzio.

created.description: The date and time when consent to this policy version was given.

ip.description: The IP address the consent was given from.

user_agent.description: The User Agent of the device the consent was given from.

entries.description:
A list of entries to submit to the log.
You can submit up to 100 entries per request by specifying them in a collection this way;
entries[0][created]
entries[0][message]
entries[0][severity]
entries[1][created]
entries[2][message]
entries[3][severity]
etc...

created.description: Timestamp representing when the log entry was created.

sequence.description: An incrementing number, used to tie break sorting if created dates are identical for entries.

component_id.description: A string referrring to the component that generated this log statement

event_type.description: A string referring to an event/method occurring inside the component referred to by component_id

call_uuid.description: For entries related to phone calls, contains the correlation uuid

sms_id.description: For entries related to sms, contains the correlation uuid

full_message.description: Provides more detail to the log, for things like stack traces.

number_id.description: The unique ID for this number.

created.description: When the number was added to this customer's account.

text.description: The text to update the CNAM value with before showing it to the receiver of the call.

e164.description: The international E.164 formatted representation of the number.

international_format.description: The internationally recognized representation of the phone number.

local_format.description: The locally formatted representation of the phone number.

country_iso.description: The country the phone number is from, formatted as ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

cnam.description: The name the number's owner if available.

region.description: Details about the country or city (if available) where the phone number is from.

editable_fields.description: A list of fields the user is permitted to edit. This may vary based on the account's settings.

text.description: The text to update the CNAM value with before showing it to the receiver of the call.

device_id.description: A unique ID representing the device. This will remain the same when when logging out of the app and signing back in with a different username.

claims_token.description: If returned, this value must be used as "Bearer Token" on future requests.

assigned_groups.description: A list of groups the user is member of.

account_groups.description: A list of groups on account.

available_numbers.description: A list of numbers on the Telzio Account that this user is allowed to make calls from.

account_tags.description: A list of tags on the Telzio Account

legal_policies.description:
Contains a list of policies the user must consent to.
Some policies may not be in effect yet, but should still be presented to the user upon login. This is defined by the policy's _"effective date"_.

current_owner.description: In case query_result is "conversation_exists_no_access", this shows who currently owns the conversation.

queue_id.description: The unique ID of the queue.

agents.description: A list of agents associated with this queue.

calls.description: A list of calls currently going through this queue.

enabled.description: Defines if the user is available to take calls or not.

grace_time.description: Defines a period of time to wait after each ended call, before allowing new calls to be directed to this agent.

gracing_time_left.description: If the agent is currently in a gracing period, this displays how much time is left.

event_timestamps.description: A list of timestamps for when certain events occurred for this call.

event_durations.description:
A list of int showing how many seconds the call had a certain status.
This can for example be used to show hold time and current talk time.

agents_total.description: The total number of agents assigned to the queue.

agents_idle.description: The number of online agents who are currently not on the phone and available to take calls.

agents_busy.description: The number of online agents who are currently talking to someone, and can't take any new calls right now.

agents_gracing.description:
The number of online agents who are now in gracing-mode because they recently have been talking.
Gracing mode allows agents some time to wrap up their previous call before taking a new one.

agents_offline.description: The total number of offline agents, who are either not connected to Telzio or marked as unavailable in the queue.

calls_waiting.description: Current number of calls waiting in the queue.

calls_connected.description: Current number of calls currently connected to an agent.

longest_hold_time.description: The the longest time any of the current callers in the queue has been waiting.

average_hold_time.description: The average hold time of current callers.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the call

number_id.description: The telzio number_id that for inbound calls was called, or for outbound calls was called from.

recording_id.description: The unique ID of the recording.

call_id.description: The Call ID of the call associated with the recording

from.description: Phone number or username of caller

duration.description: The playback length of the recording in seconds

tags.description: A list of objects containing the tags that are currently assigned to the recording.

comments.description: A list of objects containing the comments added to the recording.

assignment.description: A list of the users or groups that have been assigned to the recording.

data.description: List of timeline events created (if any) by this update.

text.description: The text in the SMS. This can be null if the sender only included a picture.
text.example: There's A Message In My Alpha-Bits...

created.description: When the SMS was sent or received.

media_attachments.description: If this message has media attached, these are the IDs of those.

sms_media_id.description: The unique ID associated with this SMS media.

mime_type.description: The mime type of the binary file.

sms_media_upload_id.description: A temporary ID for an uploaded file, that cane be used as a media attachment in an SMS.

sip_uri.description: SIP URI used when creating a sip connection

from_name.description: Name portion of from header to use

ws_sip_endpoints.description: List of available websocket sip endpoints

sounds.description: A list of sounds the user has chosen on their device.

ringtone.description: The filename of the sound to play when new calls come in.

new_sms.description: The filename of the sound to play when a new SMS arrives.

new_voicemail.description: The filename of the sound to play when new voicemail arrives.

new_fax.description: The filename of the sound to play when a new fax arrived.

new_assignment.description: The filename of the sound to play when someone is assigned to yourself.

notifications.description: The filename of the sound to play when other notifications occur in the app.

action.description: The type of action taken when an incoming call's spam score is above a rule's threshold.

spam_filter_rule_id.description: The unique ID for the spam filter rule.

threshold.description: Calls with a spam score above the threshold will trigger the rule's action.

number_id.description: Specify an ID of a number on the account to let the rule apply only to that number.

tag_id.description: The unique ID for the tag.

active.description: Indicates whether or not the tag is usable in Telzio. When deleted, active is set to false.

data.description: A list of objects containing the basic details about each voicemail message.

has_more.description: Defines if there are more objects available via paging.

tags.description: The tags assigned to the timeline at this point in time.

created.description: When the tags were assigned to the timeline.

voice_id.description: The unique ID of the voice used to generate the greeting.

text.description: The text used when generating the greeting.

name.description: The database name of the time zone.

display_name.description: Display name of the time zone in a condensed list view.

sort_order.description: An arbitrary sort order for a condensed list of time zones.

country_iso.description: The ISO Alpha-2 representation of the primary country associated with the time zone.

timeline_event_id.description: The ID of the timeline the event is associated with.

call_flow_id.description: The ID of the call flow calls with a spam score higher than the rule's threshold should be transferred to.

timeout.description: The time to ring the user's phone before transferring the call to the destination.

destination.description: The destination calls are directed to. If set to _null_, the call will just keep ringing and eventually hang up when the timeout period is reached.

timeout.description: The time to ring the user's phone before transferring the call to the destination.

phone_number.description: Required if `destination_type` is set to `phone_number`. Must be formatted in E164 with leading "+".

message.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error. This error can be shown to the end user.

user_id.description: The unique ID representing the user.

has_avatar.description: Defines whether or not the user has a custom avatar.

groups.description: A list of groups the user is currently a member of.

queue_agents.description: A list of Queue Agents associated with this user.

username.description: The user's username. Can not be changed.

has_avatar.description: Defines whether or not the user has a custom avatar.

time_zone.description: The user's timezone. Defaults to account's default timezone.

default_number_id.description: The default number used when making outbound calls.

hold_music_id.description: The ID of the hold music for the user, when transferring or putting calls on hold.

voicemail_pin.description: If set, the user will be asked to enter this pin when calling the voicemail box.

time_zone.description:
The user's timezone. Defaults to account's default time zone.
See /utilities/time_zones for a list of available time zones.

default_number_id.description: The default number used when making outbound calls.

hold_music_id.description: The ID of the hold music for the user, when transferring or putting calls on hold.

voicemail_pin.description: If set, the user will be asked to enter this pin when calling the voicemail box.

user_group_id.description: The unique ID representing this user group.

next_page_id.description: Used to obtain the next page of data when more entries than can fit in one page is available.

file.description: An mp3 or wav file with a max file size of 6mb.

voice_id.description: The unique ID of the voice used to generate the greeting.

text.description: The text used when generating the greeting.

voice_id.description: The unique ID of the voice.

display_name.description: Human readably display name for this language and gender combination.

language.description: The language used when generating text-to-speech with this voice.

voicemail_id.description: The unique ID of the voicemail.

call_id.description: The Call ID of the call associated with the voicemail

duration.description: The playback duration of the voicemail in seconds

transcription.description: A voice-to-text transcription of the voicemail.
transcription.example: Gosh, Its Not Like The Internet To Go Crazy About Something Small And Stupid.

tags.description: A list of objects containing the tags that are currently assigned to the voicemail.

assignment.description: The user or group of users the Voicemail currently is assigned to.

data.description: A list of objects containing the basic details about each voicemail message.

has_more.description: Defines if there are more objects available via paging.

data.description: List of timeline events created (if any) by this update.

stun_servers.description: List of STUN servers (if any) to use

Bearer Token.description: Standard Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. Example: "bearer {token}"
Bearer Token.name: Authorization
